intro: Clidemia macrandra, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. Clidemia macrandra is an important component of the native Hawaiian flora, contributing to the unique biodiversity of the region. It is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, making it a common sight in coastal and lowland areas.
